3: Lucia's M.I.N.D. is shaking violently once again, killing the lights in her surroundings. The Mind Beacon in the distance seems to have grown dimmer, too.
It's happening again... I need to leave now. I can still stop the merge!
The pitch darkness returns, but it does not stop Lucia.
Shards of memory hover in the air, seemingly luring her to reach out for them.
The memories before the divergence point are back...
She reaches out for the shard in front of her, but she stops as she hesitates and looks up at the Mind Beacon.
It could be a clue, or it could be a trap to stall me...
Lucia feels much safer seeing the Mind Beacon's soothing light. She reaches out for the shard.
Then, Lucia's childhood voice can be heard coming from the depths of the abyss...
Once upon a time, an evil king was all by himself. He had the elixir of life, but he never shared it with anyone.
In the faded memory, Luna is sitting in Lucia's arms and listening to her reading a story from a magazine she found.
And war broke out one day. A lot of people died.
He went to his people and shouted, 'I can share my elixir of life with you.'
Lucia holds on to Luna's hand as she reads the book, rubbing the back of her hand.
Some people said no because they didn't believe him, but some said yes because they were desperate.
But most of the people who drank the elixir died. Those who survived had scales and horns growing out of their body. They looked like the evil king now.
People were angry, thinking they'd been tricked. They stopped fighting amongst themselves and tried to fight the evil king and those who'd turned into monsters.
Why did they try to fight those who'd turned into monsters?
Because those people became immortal monsters. The humans were afraid that they wouldn't be able to fight the monsters if they ever got bullied by them.
Why didn't the humans just drink the elixir themselves?
Because they were afraid that the elixir would either kill them or turn them into monsters.
...So what happened next?
The leader of the humans caught one of the monsters. 'If you can poison the evil king's drink and kill him, I shall reward you properly,' the leader politely said to the monster.
The monster happily agreed. After the monster passed the poisoned drink to the lonely king, he drank it all with a smile on his face, because it'd been so long since he last spent time with anyone.
Lucia picks up the blanket on the floor and covers Luna with it.
Did the evil king die?
He did, and the humans captured all the monsters. The world was all peaceful again with just humans in it. How wonderful.
But how is it wonderful? Wasn't it the humans who started the war? If they hadn't, the evil king wouldn't have decided to hand out his elixir.
That's true, but that's how it goes in the story.
Poor evil king...
Why? A lot of people died because of his elixir!
But he only handed out his elixir because the war had killed a lot of people, no?
Should he just sit around and hope the world would get better?
Lucia puts down the magazine. She pats Luna on the back as she thinks about Luna's question.
But that's still not a good reason for the evil king to go around handing out his evil elixir. There has to be a different solution!
Like what?
...I don't know, but there has to be!
Lucia's M.I.N.D. is now shaking violently again, sending the shards of memories flying in the air.
People are always afraid of those different from themselves. They try to get rid of them if they can't use them.
So I made myself a promise... I wanted to build a paradise for us, an eternal paradise for just the two of us...
As the red lights return, Lucia can hear something speaking to her—something that looks like Luna.
A paradise for us... with all the monsters...
The Mind Beacon is now flashing rapidly, as if calling for Lucia.
These memories won't change a thing no matter how much time I spend looking at them. I should go now. They're waiting for me.
The pitch darkness clears up. Right above the abyss, a star shines brighter than ever.
Target found. I'm moving on.
